Class CykCommand

java.lang.Object
bg.tu_varna.sit.a1.f22621621.commands.CykCommand
All Implemented Interfaces:
Command
public class CykCommand extends Object implements Command
The type CykCommand. It checks if a word is in the language of a Grammar.

  • Method Details

    • invoke

      public void invoke(String[] input)
      Checks if a file is open and if it isn't a NoFileOpenException is thrown. Checks if the arguments length is the correct amount and if it isn't an InvalidInputException is thrown. Gets the Grammar from the Grammar Set and if that operation fails a GrammarIDNotFoundException is thrown. Then it checks if the Grammar is in Chomsky Normal Form and if it isn't an error message is displayed. The algorithm checks all parts of the word, starting from length 1 and then moving on to longer parts. It splits longer Strings than 1 in two parts and checks if a Rule in the Grammar can combine both parts. If there is a match it records the nonterminal as matching the entire String. The word is in the language of the Grammar if the entire word can be generated by the start symbol. It keeps track of the possible combinations using a 3D array.
      Specified by:
      invoke in interface Command
      Parameters:
      input - - the user input
      Throws:
      InvalidInputException - - when the number of input arguments doesn't match the command arguments count
      NoFileOpenedException - - when a file isn't open
      GrammarIDNotFoundException - - when a Grammar isn't found

    • CYK

      private void CYK(Grammar grammar, String word)
